bibl.title: Letter from W. Edwin Hemphill to Philip Showalter Hench, January 30, 1952

div1.p: Hemphill will send Hench additional copies of the “Virginia Cavalcade.”

div1.head: Letter from W. Edwin Hemphill to Philip Showalter Hench, January 30, 1952
div1.opener:
COMMONWEALTH OF VIRGINIA
VIRGINIA
PERSEVERANDO
GENERAL LIBRARY DIVISION
ARCHIVES DIVISION
LAND OFFICE
EXTENSION DIVISION
PUBLICATIONS DIVISION
HISTORY DIVISION
RANDOLPH W. CHURCH
STATE LIBRARIAN
RAY O. HUMMEL, JR.
ASSISTANT LIBRARIAN
VIRGINIA STATE LIBRARY
RICHMOND 19
January 30, 1952
Dr. Philip S. Hench
The Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I appreciate your informing me by your recent
letter of the disposition which you have made of the
six copies of the Winter issue of Virginia Cavalcade
which I had sent to you. I am glad to send to you
an additional six copies. Colonel Siler has already
seen this issue and has become a subscriber to our
magazine. I suppose but am not certain that Mr.
Clemons must have seen this article. I have sent
copies of this magazine to Mr. Paul Blincoe of Ashland,
Virginia, to Mrs. N. M. Gill of Farmville, Virginia,
and to the Misses Reed of Blackstone, Virginia.

We still appreciate the service which you rendered
in connection with this article on Walter Reed and your
interest in it.
div1.closer:
Yours sincerely, W. Edwin Hemphill, Head
History Division WEH/eh
Encl.
235-B
